Technical Changes # Die Data Pack version ist nun 77 Die Resource Pack version ist nun 61 “Command Syntax” report now contains information about required permission level Data Pack Version 77 # Neue optionale Felder “can_be_sheared” und “shearing_sound” wurden zum equippable item component hinzugefÃ¼gt Es wurde eine MÃ¶glichkeit hinzugefÃ¼gt, sehr einfache Dialoge fÃ¼r Benutzer anzuzeigen AddedÂ customÂ - ein neuerÂ click_eventÂ action type fÃ¼r text components Benutzer werden nun zur BestÃ¤tigung aufgefordert, bevor sie einen Befehl aus der run_command-Klickaktion in BÃ¼chern und im Chat ausfÃ¼hren, wenn der Befehl nicht geparst werden kann oder erhÃ¶hte Berechtigungen erfordert (d.h. hÃ¶her als 0) Dialogs # Ein Paar Beispiele des neuen Dialogs systems:
Keine Zeit mehr den rest zu Ã¼bersetzen ist aber auch nicht so wichtig ich denke die videos sagen schon alles
Added a way to display simple modal dialogs to a user Dialogs are stored in aÂ minecraft:dialogÂ registry, but can also be defined inline Dialogs are an experimental feature To avoid user confusion, dialog screens are marked with a warning sign next to the title Clicking on this warning leads to a dialog that explains to user that this screen is provided by custom content It also gives user an option to leave current world to avoid them being locked in infinite loop of dialogs Dialogs can be displayed by server inÂ playÂ andÂ configurationÂ connection phases However, only inline registries are allowed inÂ configuration, since registries are not yet available in that phase Dialogs always close after user selects any action Dialogs by default will also close after Escape key is pressed When this happens, dialog will run action specific to dialog type described as “exit action” below This behavior is configurable When dialog screen is closed, game goes back to previously displayed non-dialog screen or back to gameplay That means that new dialogs always replace already opened ones, if any Dialogs screens will pause the game in singleplayer mode Dialogs can be configured to be accessible from Pause menu This replaces and expands “Server Links” button added in previous versions Most dialogs follow a common layout, however exact contents depend on type: Header with title and warning button Body elements (labels, inputs, buttons and submit actions), scrollable if needed Optional footer, contains main buttons and submit actions Developer’s Note:Â Dialogs are not supposed to fully describe any in-game UI, but just to allow custom content to display simple messages and get input from users. This feature is intentially limited to match that use case.
Dialog Description Format # Dialogs are stored inÂ minecraft:dialogÂ registry that can be provided by a datapack Fields:
typeÂ - one of dialog types fromÂ minecraft:dialog_typeÂ registry type-specific<Â - see below
Common Dialog Fields # Most dialog types share some fields. To avoid duplication, they are listed in this section Fields:
titleÂ - screen title, text component Should be always visible on screen, no matter the specific type external_titleÂ - name to be used for a button leading to this dialog (for example from Pause screen), optional text component If not present,Â titleÂ will be used instead bodyÂ - optional list of body elements or a single element, see below can_close_with_escapeÂ - can dialog be dismissed with Escape key, defaultÂ true Common Button Data # Most actions in dialog types share following fields that describe apperance of a button associated with that action: labelÂ - text component tooltipÂ - optional text component to display when button is highlighted or hovered over widthÂ - width of the button, positive integer with defaultÂ 150 Click Action # Common object used in dialogs to represent clickable action on a dialog Fields: Common button data (see above) on_clickÂ - optional click event (same format asÂ click_eventÂ on text components) If not present, clicking button will simply close screen without any action Dialog Types # minecraft:notice # A simple screen with one action in footer Exit action: same asÂ action Fields:
Common dialog fields (see above) actionÂ - click action (see above), defaults to button withÂ gui.okÂ label and no action or tooltip minecraft:confirmation # A simple screen with two actions in footer Exit action: same asÂ noÂ action Fields:
Common dialog fields (see above) yesÂ - click action (see above) for positive outcome noÂ - click action (see above) for negative outcome minecraft:multi_action # A scrollable list of actions arranged in columns Screen also has button in footer that runs exit action and closes the screen Label will beÂ gui.cancelÂ if dialog has defined exit action andÂ gui.backÂ if it has no side effects Exit action: defined inÂ on_cancelÂ field Fields:
Common dialog fields (see above) actionsÂ - non-empty list of click actions (see above) on_cancelÂ - optional click event (same format asÂ click_eventÂ on text components) columnsÂ - positive integer describing number of columns, default:Â 2 minecraft:server_links # A scrollable list of links received from server inÂ minecraft:server_linksÂ packet, arranged in columns Screen also has button in footer that runs exit action and closes the screen Label will beÂ gui.cancelÂ if dialog has defined exit action andÂ gui.backÂ if it has no side effects Note: this is a replacement for previous Server Links screen, but now with an additional body Exit action: defined inÂ on_cancelÂ field Fields:
Common dialog fields (see above) on_cancelÂ - optional click event (same format asÂ click_eventÂ on text components) columnsÂ - positive integer describing number of columns, default:Â 2 button_widthÂ - width of buttons in the list, positive integer with defaultÂ 150 minecraft:dialog_list # A scrollable list of buttons leading directly to other dialogs, arranged in columns Titles of those buttons will be taken fromÂ external_titleÂ fields of targeted dialogs Screen also has button in footer that runs exit action and closes the screen Label will beÂ gui.cancelÂ if dialog has defined exit action andÂ gui.backÂ if it has no side effects Exit action: defined inÂ on_cancelÂ field Fields:
Common dialog fields (see above) dialogsÂ - dialog, a list of dialogs or a dialog tag on_cancelÂ - optional click event (same format asÂ click_eventÂ on text components) columnsÂ - positive integer describing number of columns, default:Â 2 button_widthÂ - width of buttons in the list, positive integer with defaultÂ 150 minecraft:simple_input_form # A screen that accepts user inputs Has a single submit action with in a footer Exit action: none (submitting data closes screen, but does not run any action outside of sending data to server) Fields:
Common dialog fields (see above) inputsÂ - non-empty list of inputs controls, see below actionÂ - submit action, see below minecraft:multi_action_input_form # A screen that accepts user inputs Can have multiple submit actions Has no footer, submit actions are appended to a body Exit action: none (submitting data closes screen, but does not run any action outside of sending data to server) Fields:
Common dialog fields (see above) inputsÂ - non-empty list of inputs controls, see below actionsÂ - non-empty list of submit actions, see below Dialog Body Types # All dialogs have a list of body elements describing contents between title and actions or inputs Fields:
typeÂ - one of dialog body types fromÂ minecraft:dialog_body_typeÂ registry type-specific<Â - see below
minecraft:plain_message # A multiline label Fields:
contentsÂ - text component widthÂ - maximum width of message, positive integer with defaultÂ 200 minecraft:item # Item with optional description If description is present, it will be rendered to the right of item Item will be rendered as if it was in inventory slot Item is not scaled even ifÂ widthÂ andÂ heightÂ are set to values other than default Fields:
itemÂ - item stack with count descriptionÂ - optional object with fields: contentsÂ - text component widthÂ - maximum width of contents, positive integer with defaultÂ 200 Can also be just be text component show_decorationsÂ - ifÂ true, count and damage bar will be rendered over the item, default:Â true show_tooltipÂ - ifÂ true, item tooltip will show up when item is hovered, default:Â true widthÂ - horizontal size of element, default:Â 16 heightÂ - vertical size of element, default:Â 16 Input Control Types # Input dialog uses a set of controls to accept user input When submitted, current value of input will be converted to a string and sent to the server as described by Submit Action section below Fields:
typeÂ - one of input control types fromÂ minecraft:input_control_typeÂ registry keyÂ - string identifier of value used when submitting data, must be a valid template argument (letters, digits andÂ _) type-specific<Â - see below
minecraft:text # Simple text input Sends current contents without modification Fields:
widthÂ - width of input, positive integer with default:Â 200 labelÂ - a text component to be displayed to the left of control label_visibleÂ - controls label visibility, default:Â true initialÂ - initial contents, default:Â ""Â (empty) minecraft:boolean # A plain checkbox with a label Fields:
labelÂ - a text component to be displayed to the right of control initialÂ - an initial value, default:Â falseÂ (i.e. unchecked) on_trueÂ - a string value to send when control is checked, default: ’true' on_falseÂ - a string value to send when control is unchecked, default: ‘false’ minecraft:single_option # A button that cycles between a set of options when clicked Sends value associated with currently selected preset Fields:
labelÂ - a text component to be displayed on the button label_visibleÂ - ifÂ true, label will be incorporated into button text, default:Â true widthÂ - width of button, positive integer with default:Â 200 optionsÂ - a list of objects with fields: idÂ - a string value to send on submit displayÂ - a text component to display on button, optional (if not present,Â idÂ is used) initialÂ - an optional boolean flag that selects initial option (only one option can have it set toÂ true) Additionaly list might also contain plain string - in that case it’s equivalent to a single entry with fieldÂ idÂ set to that string and other fields set to default minecraft:number_range # A slider for picking a numeric value out of some range Sends currently selected value Whole numbers will be sent without decimal point Fields:
labelÂ - a text component to be used as a slider label label_formatÂ - a translation key to be used for building label (first argument is contents ofÂ labelÂ field, second argument is current value), default:Â options.generic_value widthÂ - width of input, positive integer with default:Â 200 startÂ - start value (when slider is in leftmost position) (inclusive), float endÂ - end value (when slider is in rightmost position) (inclusive), float stepsÂ - number of increments, positive integer Note: value ofÂ 1Â means that slider will have two positions (start and end) initialÂ - initial value of slider, rounded down nearest step, must be within range, defaults toÂ min Submit Actions # Every submit action on input dialog has a button associated with it When one of those buttons is clicked, values of all inputs will be collected and sent to a server using one of methods described below idÂ field of a submit action will be included as an input with keyÂ action Submit action fields: Common button data (see above) idÂ - string identifier of an action on_submitÂ - submit method to run when button is clicked, object with following fields: typeÂ - one of submit method types fromÂ minecraft:submit_method_typeÂ registry type-specific<Â - see below
Note: server does not validate individual values as they arrive as filled commands or custom payloads Submit Method Types # minecraft:command_template # This method will build a command using a provided macro template and request the server to run it (same asÂ minecraft:run_commandÂ click event) If the command requires permission higher thanÂ 0Â (when any operator permissions are required), a confirmation dialog will be shown Macro will be expanded with values from input For example, if macro isÂ some_command $(action),Â actionÂ parameter will be expanded toÂ idÂ field of a submit action Inputs not used in macro will be ignored, while macro parameters not matching any inputs will be replaced with an empty string Fields:
templateÂ - a string with a macro template to be interpreted as a command minecraft:custom_template # This method will build a custom server click action using a provided macro template and send it to the server (same asÂ minecraft:customÂ click event) Macro will be expanded with values from input Inputs not used in macro will be ignored, while macro parameters not matching any inputs will be replaced with an empty string Fields:
templateÂ - a string with a macro template to be used as a payload idÂ - namespaced ID minecraft:custom_form # This method will build a custom server click action from all values and request the server to run it (same asÂ minecraft:customÂ click event) Format: keys are separated from values with horizontal tabulation (U+0009) character key-value entries are separated with line feed (U+000A) character If charactersÂ U+0009Â andÂ U+000AÂ are present in any key or value, they will be escaped toÂ \tÂ andÂ \n Fields:
idÂ - namespaced ID Built-in dialogs # The built-in datapack contains some custom dialogs to provide customization of specific screens used by client
minecraft:server_links # Replacement for previously existing “Server Links” screen Meant to simplify migration for servers that used this feature previously minecraft:custom_options # Shows contents ofÂ minecraft:pause_screen_additionsÂ tag (see below) Lets user select a specific dialog if this tag contains multiple entries Note: Since this tag is meant for interoperability, any content that replaces this dialog should be careful to not hide other dialog providers Dialog Command # New command has been added to show dialog to clients Syntax:
dialog show >targets< >dialog<Â - show dialog to player(s) targets<Â - player name, UUID or a player selector
dialog<Â - a namespaced ID fromÂ minecraft:dialogÂ registry or inline dialog value as described above
Returns number of players inÂ targetsÂ argument dialog clear >targets<Â - clean dialog for player(s), if they have any visible targets<Â - player name, UUID or a player selector
Returns number of players inÂ targetsÂ argument Pause Screen Configuration # A data pack can request some of the available dialogs to be accessible from Pause screen This feature replaces “Server Links” button and is placed on Pause screen according to the same rules Buttons leading to dialogs exposed in this way will use label described inÂ external_titleÂ field This feature is configured byÂ minecraft:pause_screen_additionsÂ dialog tag: If this tag is not specified or is empty but the server has sentÂ server_linksÂ packet, tag will be handled as if it containedÂ minecraft:server_linksÂ dialog Note: this matches previous Server Links feature behavior If this dialog is removed, the tag remains empty If this tag is still empty, button is not visible (“Send Feedback” and “Report Bugs” buttons are visible instead) If this tag has a single element, Pause screen button will lead directly to this dialog If this tag has multiple elements, Pause screen button will lead toÂ minecraft:custom_optionsÂ which (by default) lets user select one of the tag elements If this dialog is removed, button is not visible Text Components # Click Events # New click actionÂ minecraft:customÂ has been added When user clicks a component with this click action, client will send a dedicated packetÂ minecraft:custom_click_actionÂ to a server The intended use is as an alternative forÂ run_commandÂ to be used by modded servers without worrying about having to add custom commands This packet has no functionality on vanilla servers Fields: idÂ - namespaced ID payloadÂ - optional string field Dialog Click Event # New actionÂ show_dialogÂ has been added When user clicks this component, a dialog will be opened for them Fields: dialogÂ - a namespaced ID fromÂ minecraft:dialogÂ registry or inline dialog value as described above Attributes # GhastsÂ flying_speedÂ attribute # Ghasts now have aÂ flying_speedÂ attribute that affects their flying speed Data Components # equippableÂ Item Component # Added new optional field:Â can_be_shearedÂ (boolean) IfÂ true, players can use Shears to remove this equippable item from a target mob by right-clicking, provided all other shearing conditions are satisfied If not specified, it defaults toÂ false Added new optional field:Â shearing_soundÂ (sound event) It’s a sound event that plays when the equippable item is sheared If not specified, it defaults to theÂ item.shears.snipÂ sound event Resource Pack Version 61 # UI Sprites # AddedÂ icon/music_notesÂ andÂ toast/now_playingÂ sprites

Technical Changes # The Data Pack version is now 78 The Resource Pack version is now 62 Data Pack Version 78 # Datadriven Entity Models/Animation Soon? Dialogs # run_commandÂ click actions will now correctly close dialogs and book screens even if the command does not require elevated permissions Dialogs should now correctly return to the previous non-dialog screen on close in all cases If a new dialog is received by the client while warning screen is visible, it will not replace it, but when user clicks the “Back” button, the new dialog will be restored instead The sizes of elements in dialogs are now restricted: buttons - betweenÂ 1Â andÂ 1024Â (inclusive) minecraft:plain_messageÂ dialog body - betweenÂ 1Â andÂ 1024Â (inclusive) minecraft:itemÂ dialog body widthÂ ofÂ descriptionÂ - betweenÂ 1Â andÂ 1024Â (inclusive) widthÂ - betweenÂ 1Â andÂ 256Â (inclusive) heightÂ - betweenÂ 1Â andÂ 256Â (inclusive) minecraft:textÂ input control - betweenÂ 1Â andÂ 1024Â (inclusive) minecraft:single_optionÂ input control - betweenÂ 1Â andÂ 1024Â (inclusive) minecraft:number_rangeÂ input control - betweenÂ 1Â andÂ 1024Â (inclusive) minecraft:textÂ Input Control # max_lengthÂ - maximum length of input, positive integer with default of 32 multilineÂ - if present, allows users to input multiple lines, optional object with fields: max_linesÂ - if present, limits maximum lines, optional positive integer heightÂ - height of input, optional integer in rangeÂ 1Â toÂ 512 If this field is omitted, butÂ max_linesÂ is present, the height will be chosen to fit the maximum number of lines If this andÂ max_linesÂ are both omitted, it will default to a height that fits 4 lines minecraft:number_rangeÂ Input Control # TheÂ stepsÂ field has been replaced with a new field: stepÂ - step size, optional positive float If present, only values ofÂ initial + >any integer< * stepÂ will be allowed If absent, any value from range the is allowed initialÂ - if not specified, now defaults to the middle of the range minecraft:multi_action_input_formÂ Dialog Type # Added new fieldÂ columnsÂ - positive integer describing number of columns, default:Â 2 Resource Pack Version 62 # Sounds # AddedÂ entity/leashknot/breakÂ for when a Lead snaps The following sounds have been renamed: entity/leashknot/break1Â ->Â entity/leashknot/unleash1 entity/leashknot/break2Â ->Â entity/leashknot/unleash2 entity/leashknot/break3Â ->Â entity/leashknot/unleash3 entity/leashknot/place1Â ->Â entity/leashknot/leash1 entity/leashknot/place2Â ->Â entity/leashknot/leash2 entity/leashknot/place3Â ->Â entity/leashknot/leash3 The following sounds have been added for shearing Saddles, Horse Armor, and Carpets from Llamas mob/horse/armor_unequip mob/horse/saddle_unequip mob/llama/unequip
